intro: Desmocladus microcarpus, commonly known as the small-fruited desmocladus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed soils or along roadsides. The plant has small, palmately lobed leaves and produces yellow flowers that are followed by small, round fruits. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological studies due to its adaptability and growth habits.
